result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: October 17, 2016

Case called at 3:33 PM.
Defendant Patrick Joseph Allen in court with attorney Joseph Pecora.  Defendant Patrick Joseph Allen in custody.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State moves to DRI Counts 1-3 Per/Agreement
No objection 
So ordered
Sentencing Hearing 10/05/2016

Case called 
This case was called but nothing was done in it.

Case called at 2:51 PM.
Defendant Patrick Joseph Allen in court,  and  with attorney Joseph Pecora.  Defendant Patrick Joseph Allen in custody.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Pecora informs the court this matter is resolved, see plea agreement.
Continue for sentencing hearing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 5, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 28, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Case called at 10:12 AM.
Defendant Patrick Joseph Allen in court with attorney Joseph Pecora.  Defendant Patrick Joseph Allen in custody.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Pecora informs the court re: status and moves to continue for a global offer in all cases.
No objection  Status conference scheduled for July 20, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Case called at 2:12 PM.
Defendant Patrick Joseph Allen in court with attorney Joseph Pecora.  Defendant Patrick Joseph Allen in custody.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Pecora moves for 30 day continuance and wishes to address modification of bond.
State objects to any modification at this time.
Attorney Pecora responds to the state's objection.
Court "DENIES" any modification at this time.  Status conference scheduled for May 31, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Case called at 3:54 PM.
Defendant Patrick Joseph Allen in court with attorney Nancy L. Moore.  Defendant Patrick Joseph Allen in custody.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Moore moves for withdrawal for reasons stated on the record.
Court grants motion and signs order for withdrawal.  Status conference scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 09:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Defendant's For Withdrawal Of Defense Counsel
Motion hearing on April 5, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Case called at 9:10 AM.
Defendant Patrick Joseph Allen in court with attorney Nancy L. Moore.  Defendant Patrick Joseph Allen in custody.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called no action taken.
Continue for status.  Status conference scheduled for April 26, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Amending Bail/Bond

Signature bond set at $2500.00.
Defendant shall reside with his parents in Argyle at all times.
Defendant may leave his home for employment purposes at the Mexican Cheese Producers from 12:30 am to 12:00 noon Monday through Thursday and every other Friday.
If defendant leaves his residence he must be in the company of a parent.  If defendant is able to maintain employment hours may accomodate 1 -2 hrs overtime.
 Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages or nonprescription controlled substances, or any prescription medicine for which the defendant does not have a current prescription.
Defendant shall not enter into any establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverage.
Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact with Cody Young.
Status conference at 03-15-2016 01:30 pm

Case called at 2:35 PM.
Attorney Nancy L. Moore appeared by phone means for Defendant Patrick Joseph Allen. Prosecuting Atty Katherine M. Findley appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Patrick Joseph Allen not in court.
DA Findley informs the court this matter is not resolved.
Attorney Moore informs the court she would like to amend bond conditions, state wants to discuss this first.
State moves to continue for status.  Status conference scheduled for March 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference at 02-02-2016 01:30 pm

Defendant Patrick Joseph Allen in court with attorney Nancy L. Moore.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case Called @ 9:10 AM.

Attorney Moore informs the court her client wishes to waive the preliminary hearing in this case, and files the waiver form with the court.

Court questions defendant RE: waiver of preliminary hearing.
Court finds waiver is made freely, knowingly and voluntarily.
Court accepts waiver and orders the defendant be bound over for arraignment.

State files information, attorney Moore waives formal reading.
Defendant stand "MUTE"
Court enters plea "NOT GUITY" on behalf of the defendant.  Status conference scheduled for February 2, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing at 12-18-2015 08:30 am
Patrick Joseph Allen

Signature bond set at $2500.00.
Defendant shall reside with Jay Heller, 3620 Marsh Rd., Madison, WI 53718.(From Sunday thru Friday 6 pm curfew unless with his employer,Jay Heller; or until Saturday at 6 pm if working overtime.
Defendant shall reside with his parents in Argyle from Friday evening to Sunday evening(defendant shall stay in the house and only leave in the company of his parents).
Def shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages or nonprescription controlled substances or any prescription medicine for which the defendant does not have a current prescription.
Defendant shall not enter into any establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages.
Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact with Cody Young.
